drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Fluoxetine is a potent CYP2D6 inhibitor. Converts any CYP2D6 phenotype to functional poor metabolizer status, blocking codeine-to-morphine conversion.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Therapeutic failure of codeine analgesia regardless of patient genotype
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. Use non-opioid analgesic or opioid not dependent on CYP2D6 activation (morphine, hydromorphone).

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Paroxetine is a potent CYP2D6 inhibitor. Blocks codeine bioactivation to morphine.
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. Use alternative analgesic or alternative antidepressant.
references: Lam YWF, et al. J Clin Psychopharmacol. 2002;22(1):68-72

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Fluoxetine potently inhibits CYP2D6, blocking tamoxifen conversion to endoxifen (active metabolite).
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Reduced tamoxifen efficacy; increased breast cancer recurrence risk
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: AVOID combination. Switch antidepressant to one with minimal CYP2D6 inhibition (e.g., venlafaxine, citalopram, escitalopram).

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Paroxetine potently inhibits CYP2D6, blocking endoxifen formation.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Reduced tamoxifen efficacy; increased breast cancer recurrence risk
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: AVOID combination. Use alternative antidepressant (venlafaxine, citalopram).

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Omeprazole inhibits CYP2C19, reducing clopidogrel bioactivation. Esomeprazole has similar effect.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Reduced antiplatelet effect of clopidogrel; increased cardiovascular event risk
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Use pantoprazole (minimal CYP2C19 inhibition) if PPI needed with clopidogrel.
references: FDA Drug Safety Communication: Clopidogrel and PPIs (2009)
Kwok CS, et al. Am J Gastroenterol. 2012;107(7):1011-1019

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Fluconazole inhibits CYP2C9, reducing S-warfarin metabolism. Potentiates anticoagulation effect.
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose by 25-50% when initiating fluconazole. Monitor INR every 2-3 days until stable.
references: Black DJ, et al. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1999;47(5):577-581

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Amiodarone inhibits CYP2C9 and CYP1A2, reducing warfarin clearance. Effect persists for months after amiodarone discontinuation.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Significantly elevated INR; major bleeding risk
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose by 30-50% when initiating amiodarone. Monitor INR closely for weeks. Interaction persists for months after amiodarone stop.

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Carbamazepine induces CYP3A4 and possibly CYP2C19, potentially increasing citalopram metabolism.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Reduced citalopram plasma levels; potential therapeutic failure of antidepressant
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor for antidepressant efficacy. Consider dose increase or alternative antidepressant.
references: Spina E, et al. Ther Drug Monit. 2008;30(2):143-150

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Rifampin is a potent inducer of CYP2C9, CYP3A4, and CYP1A2, dramatically increasing warfarin clearance.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Therapeutic failure of warfarin; subtherapeutic INR; thromboembolic risk
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination if possible. If unavoidable, increase warfarin dose 2-5x with frequent INR monitoring. Re-adjust dose when rifampin stopped.
references: Heimark LD, et al. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1987;42(4):388-394

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Fluoxetine inhibits CYP2D6, reducing metoprolol metabolism and increasing its plasma concentration.
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor heart rate and blood pressure. Consider dose reduction of metoprolol or switch to atenolol (renally eliminated).
references: Hemeryck A, Belpaire FM. Curr Drug Metab. 2002;3(1):13-37

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Ketoconazole potently inhibits CYP3A4, greatly increasing simvastatin exposure.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Massively elevated statin levels; rhabdomyolysis risk
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: CONTRAINDICATED. Do not co-administer. Temporarily discontinue simvastatin during azole antifungal therapy.

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Both drugs increase serotonin levels. Combination increases serotonin syndrome risk.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Serotonin syndrome: hyperthermia, rigidity, myoclonus, autonomic instability, delirium
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Use with caution. Monitor for serotonin syndrome symptoms. Consider non-serotonergic analgesic alternatives.

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: PPIs may reduce renal clearance of methotrexate through inhibition of renal transporters.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Increased methotrexate exposure; increased toxicity risk (myelosuppression, mucositis)
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor methotrexate levels closely if PPI is required. Consider H2 blocker as alternative acid suppression.
references: Bezabeh S, et al. J Oncol Pharm Pract. 2012;18(4):409-416

drug_drug_interactions.mechanism: Bupropion is a moderate CYP2D6 inhibitor, potentially reducing endoxifen formation.
drug_drug_interactions.clinical_effect: Modestly reduced tamoxifen efficacy; clinical significance debated
drug_drug_interactions.recommendation: Consider alternative antidepressant with lower CYP2D6 inhibition (venlafaxine, citalopram) if possible.
references: Borges S, et al. J Clin Pharmacol. 2006;46(12):1378-1387
